data.description: Calculates the word densities of words and phrases in the article.
data.name: CalcWordDensity
aid
data.description: Application ID. Set this to a string (100 charachers or less) to identify your application to the server. At this point, applications do not require registration.

data.name: apikey
data.description: User’s API key. Get one on the Chimp Rewriter User Management page.

data.name: email
data.description: User’s Chimp Rewriter account email. Note that the user requires a Chimp Rewriter Pro subscription.

data.name: minlength
data.description: The minimum character length for which to calculate word density. If you use 3, 2 letter words would not be included in the results.
Generates an unspun doc from one with spintax. Optionally reorders paragraphs and removes original word.
data.name: GenerateSpin
aid
data.description: Application ID. Set this to a string (100 charachers or less) to identify your application to the server. At this point, applications do not require registration.

data.name: apikey
data.description: User’s API key. Get one on the Chimp Rewriter User Management page.

data.name: dontincludeoriginal
data.description: If set to 1, the first first word in each set of spintax is not included in spun output. E.g. if this is found in the article: {word|syn1|syn2}, the result will only include either syn1 or syn2.

data.name: email
data.description: User’s Chimp Rewriter account email. Note that the user requires a Chimp Rewriter Pro subscription.

data.name: N/A
data.description: To protect any piece of text, simply wrap it with ###. For example, if you had a certain paragraph or code to protect, simply send “An intro sentence. ###My protected stuff### and the rest of the article”. Anything inside the hashes will not be spun. Then just replace ‘###’ with an empty string.

data.name: reorderparagraphs
data.description: If set to 1, paragraphs are randomly ordered in the result.
Spins an article with various quality paramters and return it either with spintax or as a unique unspun document.
data.name: GlobalSpin
aid
data.description: Application ID. Set this to a string (100 charachers or less) to identify your application to the server. At this point, applications do not require registration.

data.name: apikey
data.description: User’s API key. Get one on the Chimp Rewriter User Management page.

data.name: applyinstantunique
data.description: (Extra quota cost) Runs an instant unique pass over the article once spun. This replaces letters with characters that look like the original letter but have a different UTF8 value, passing copyscape 100% but garbling content to the search engines. It it recommended to protect keywords while using instant unique. Costs one extra query.

data.name: email
data.description: User’s Chimp Rewriter account email. Note that the user requires a Chimp Rewriter Pro subscription.

data.name: fullcharset
data.description: Only used if applyinstantunique = 1. This causes IU to use the full character set which has a broader range of replacements.

data.name: maxspindepth
data.description: Define a maximum spin level depth in returned article. If set to 1, no nested spin will appear in the spun result. This paramater only matters if rewrite is false. Set to 0 or ignore for no limit on spin depth.

data.name: N/A
data.description: To protect any piece of text, simply wrap it with ###. For example, if you had a certain paragraph or code to protect, simply send “An intro sentence. ###My protected stuff### and the rest of the article”. Anything inside the hashes will not be spun. Then just replace ‘###’ with an empty string.

data.name: phraseignorequality
data.description: If set to 1, quality is ignored when finding phrase replacements for phrases. This results in a huge amount of spin, but quality can vary.

data.name: posmatch
data.description: Required Part of Speech (POS) match for a spin: 4 – FullSpin, 3 – Full, 2 – Loose, 1 – Extremely Loose, 0 – None. ‘FullSpin’ removes some common POS replacements that tend to reduce quality of spin.

data.name: protectedterms
data.description: Comma separated list of words or phrases to protect from spin i.e. ‘my main keyword,my second keyword’

data.name: quality
data.description: Spin quality: 5 – Best, 4 – Better, 3 – Good, 2 – Average, 1 – All

data.name: rewrite
data.description: If set to 1, results are returned as a rewritten article with no Spintax. Otherwise, an article with Spintax is returned. Note that with rewrite as 1, the original word will always be removed.

data.name: spintidy
data.description: (Extra quota cost) Runs a spin tidy pass over the result article. This fixes any common a/an type grammar mistakes and repeated words due to phrase spinning. Generally increases the quality of the article. Costs one extra query.

data.name: spinwithinhtml
data.description:
Spin inside HTML tags. This includes

tags, for example if you send up “

Here is a paragraph

”, nothing would be spun unless spinwithinhtml is 1.

data.name: spinwithinspin
data.description: If set to 1, if there is existing spin syntax in the content you send up, the API will spin any relevant content inside this syntax. If 0, the API will skip over this content and only spin outside of existing syntax.

data.name: tagprotect
data.description: Protects anything between any syntax you define. Separate start and end syntax with a pipe ‘|’ and separate multiple tags with a comma ‘,’. For example, you could protect anything in square brackets by setting tagprotect=[|]. You could also protect anything between “begin” and “end” by setting tagprotect=[|],begin|end
Returns remaining query quota. Can also be used to test an account.
data.name: QueryStats
aid
data.description: Application ID. Set this to a string (100 charachers or less) to identify your application to the server. At this point, applications do not require registration.

data.name: apikey
data.description: User’s API key. Get one on the Chimp Rewriter User Management page.

data.name: email
data.description: User’s Chimp Rewriter account email. Note that the user requires a Chimp Rewriter Pro subscription.

data.name: simple
data.description: Returns a raw number of how many queries can be made with the account instead of the detailed format described below.
Tests the connection to the API without user credentials.
data.name: TestConnection

description: The Chimp Rewriter API allows developers to access Chimp Rewriter functionality from their own software. It is based around HTTP POST, making it easy to implement. With the help of this guide, you should be up and running in a few minutes. Authentication is achieved through an API Key, so there is no need to send sensitive password details over an unencrypted connection.
name: v1
